title: Synthetic Recap
body:
DETROIT (AP) – In a game where points were a precious commodity, the Detroit Pistons rode one man’s historic will to victory. Grant Hill, with a performance for the ages, single-handedly dragged his team across the finish line against the Indiana Pacers, 95-89.

On a night defined by grit over grace, Hill was an unstoppable force of nature. He poured in a career-high and awe-inspiring 47 points, a scoring barrage that accounted for nearly half of his team's entire offensive output. While the rest of the Pistons struggled to find their rhythm, Hill was the rhythm, attacking the rim with a breathtaking combination of power and finesse.

The Pacers, led by Reggie Miller’s 22 points, had no answer. They fought valiantly, with Rik Smits adding 16 points and Dale Davis controlling the glass with 15 rebounds, but every Indiana run was met with a defiant response from number 33 in the red, white, and blue.

Hill’s masterpiece was not a product of volume alone; it was efficiency in a crucible. He added 7 rebounds and 5 assists, demonstrating his all-around dominance. In the game's crucial final minutes, with the outcome hanging in the balance, it was Hill who seized control, hitting clutch shot after clutch shot to silence the threat.

This was more than just a win; it was a coronation. Grant Hill didn't just beat the Pacers, he carried the Pistons on his back, authoring a regular-season night that would be etched into franchise lore forever.
